intro: Hordeum anglicum, commonly known as cockle, is an annual grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows up to 1 meter tall, with slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous颖果, which are dry, indehiscent fruits containing the seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Hordeum anglicum is considered a weed in agricultural settings but has historical significance in traditional medicine and as a forage crop.
